data.title: La Cite de L'indicible Peur | Jean-Pierre Mocky | 1964 | ACMI collection
data.meta_description: Mickey, a dangerous mobster, has been arrested ‘by chance’ by Triquet, a rather insignificant police officer. Mickey is condemned to death but man..
data.text:
Mickey, a dangerous mobster, has been arrested ‘by chance’ by Triquet, a rather insignificant police officer. Mickey is condemned to death but manages to escape. Triquet is ordered to trace him all the way to the village of Barges in Auvergne (central France).

Credits: Producer, Paul Laffargue ; director, Jean-Pierre Mocky ; writers, Jean-Pierre Mocky, Gerard Klein ; photography, Eugen Schuftan ; music, Gerard Calvi ; editor, Marguerite Renoir.

Cast: Bourvil, Jean-Louis Barrault, Francis Blanche, Veronique Nordey, Jacques Dufilho, Rene-Louis Lafforgue, Jean Poiret, Raymond Rouleau.

Our collection comprises over 40,000 moving image works, acquired and catalogued between the 1940s and early 2000s. As a result, some items may reflect outdated, offensive and possibly harmful views and opinions. ACMI is working to identify and redress such usages.

Learn more about our collection and our collection policy here. If you come across harmful content on our website that you would like to report, let us know.

Please note: this archive is an ongoing body of work. Sometimes the credit information (director, year etc) isn’t available so these fields may be left blank; we are progressively filling these in with further research.
